data.content: One of the most challenging engineering tasks is to develop products based on user needs. How can we, as engineers, understand user points?
Here is a list of product design workshops & exercises list that can be used to discover user insights, solve for user problems, and improve app quality.
Map out a user’s journey of a particular design, feature, or experience. Place each experience of the journey as either “positive” or “negative.”
Understand user pain points and areas of the journey that need improvement.
Discover the user’s point of view and insights.
Create statements with fill-in-the blanks regarding users, user’s needs, and user’s motives. Ex: [User] needs to [user’s need] because [insight]. [Feature] helps [user] who want to [action].
A way to gather a user’s key insights.

This exercise will come before a “How Might We” exercise. Have individuals jot down and fill “user/wants/because/but” on a notecard. Ex: “Parents want more control over their children’s settings because it makes them feel at ease but they have trouble discovering the control panel.
Identify a user’s motives and blockers.
A way to classify and organize design features that need improvement.

Create an excel or google sheet with categorizing columns (ex: columns could be ‘surface’, ‘type’, ‘purpose’, ‘how user receives feature’). Then go through app and list in the sheet every time the particular feature appears.

After creating a taxonomy, flag commonalities or irregularities in features. It also helps to refer to a taxonomy after creating guidelines and principles to see if all features in app adhere to them.
This workshop is helpful for features such as badges, notifications, dialogue boxes, or anything in an app that is inconsistent and unorganized.
Encourages a team to brainstorm possibilities based off user insights.
Pull together insight statements. Try rephrasing them as questions by adding “How might we” at the beginning.
Ex: Insight: “MK parent users wish to have more control over push notifications. ”
HMW: “How might we give MK parent users more control over push notifications?
*Tip* Try to avoid using insights/HMWs that are too vague such as “How might we make the app more fun.”
Turn user problems into design opportunities.
Several short presentations given by experts in a certain field/area.
Invite relevant experts/cross-functional partners to give micro presentations on topics relevant to the problems the team is trying to solve for. Have the team take notes.
Inform team on other areas surrounding a particular topic.
Poke holes and identify what works/doesn’t work during the wireframe stage.
Have team go to every part of the user flow and ask “Where am I?”, “What is this page about?”, “Where can I go?”, “Does this scale across devices and locations?”
Scaled usability and understandability of a design.
Before a project is even built, assume that things went wrong with the project and has failed.
Have the original project goals and plan displayed. Then have the team create a list of “what” has failed dramatically.
Identify threats, flag risks, and brainstorm preventative measures.
In case you have more ideas, please let us know!
